pr_title: DHFPROD-5826: Array of booleans and numbers not being handled in Mapp…

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be better to have UI tests for these values rather than adding it to reference project input data. These new data don't have relevance to "Customer" data
timeline.author: srinathgit

replies.bodyText: Thanks, @srinathgit  that's fair. I initially checked with @bsrikan beforehand so I'm curious what he thinks? I could also make it a new input file unrelated to "Customer" data, or hide the edge cases in more relevant "Customer" property names.
replies.author: briantang

replies.bodyText: I think we would like to keep reference project as clean as possible. @bsrikan , let us know your thoughts
replies.author: srinathgit

replies.bodyText: When we were reviewing the test plan we wanted any enhanced test data to be added to reference project, because it is pushed to HC nightly and most of our engineers and PM use it for reviewing/testing PR.
replies.author: bsrikan

replies.bodyText: As for tests, Brian has added unit tests for the fix.
replies.author: bsrikan

replies.bodyText: I agree with @srinathgit, the example reference project should be more like a demo with (Customer) data that ties together (although it is also intended to cover many data use cases).
replies.author: wooldridge

replies.bodyText:
Looks like we're leaning towards taking out this enhancement to test data with certain edge cases to keep the 'Customer' data clean. @rjrudin could you confirm? And I can go ahead and take that out of the PR.
@bsrikan mentioned part of the Hardening week test plan was to add to test data to cover more scenarios for developers which is why I added this. So another option could be to keep these edge case additions in but give them more 'Customer' specific property names so they stay relevant to the 'Customer' data.
replies.author: briantang

replies.bodyText: @briantang you did add more test data to common.data.ts to cover these cases and I think that's fine. Let's pull those examples out of the reference project for now and push this PR through. I can't see @rjrudin having a problem with this. :-)
replies.author: wooldridge

replies.bodyText: Thanks @wooldridge, will leave it out for now so we can get this bug fix through.
replies.author: briantang

replies.bodyText: The key to me is that the entity model isn't being used to determine how data in the source panel is displayed - that's not the case, right?
replies.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: @rjrudin that is not the case, display of source data is based on the source data.
replies.author: wooldridge

timeline.message: DHFPROD-5826: Array of booleans and numbers not being handled in Mapping source data
